alert.note: Alert for Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Coastal St. Johns (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:58PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Nassau, northern St. Johns and northeastern Duval Counties through 430 PM EDT... At 358 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Amelia City to near Arlington. Movement was southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Unf, Ponte Vedra Beach, Arlington, Jacksonville Beach, Atlantic Beach, Neptune Beach, Mayport, Craig Field, San Pablo and Amelia City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Duval; Coastal Nassau; Coastal St. Johns
